uk.co.saiman.data

Interface ContinuousFunction

  • All Superinterfaces:
    uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.Copyable<ContinuousFunction>, uk.co.strangeskies.mathematics.expression.Expression<ContinuousFunction>, uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.Observable<uk.co.strangeskies.mathematics.expression.Expression<ContinuousFunction>>, uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.Self<ContinuousFunction>, uk.co.strangeskies.mathematics.expression.SelfExpression<ContinuousFunction>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ContinuousFunctionDecorator, RegularSampledContinuousFunction, SampledContinuousFunction, SampledContinuousFunctionDecorator
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ArrayRegularSampledContinuousFunction, ArraySampledContinuousFunction, CalibratedContinuousFunction, ContinuousFunctionExpression, ContinuousFunctionTransformation, SampledContinuousFunctionTransformation, SparseSampledContinuousFunction

    public interface ContinuousFunction
extends uk.co.strangeskies.mathematics.expression.SelfExpression<ContinuousFunction>
    A set of domain values (X) mapped via some continuous function to a corresponding value in the range (Y). The domain is defined by a single inclusive interval, and the function is defined for all values in the domain.

    ContinuousFunctions may be mutable, depending on implementation, but in this case they should notify listeners by way of the API provided through SelfExpression.

    TODO: Difficult to genericise over data type with acceptable performance until Project Valhalla, for now will just use double.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static ContinuousFunction EMPTY
      A very simple, immutable implementation of a continuous function describing a single point at 0 in both the domain and codomain.

    • Field Detail

      • EMPTY

        static final ContinuousFunction EMPTY
        A very simple, immutable implementation of a continuous function describing a single point at 0 in both the domain and codomain.

    • Method Detail

      • getDomain

        uk.co.strangeskies.mathematics.Range<Double> getDomain()
        Find the smallest interval containing all values in the domain of the function.
        Returns:
        The extent of the domain

      • getRange

        uk.co.strangeskies.mathematics.Range<Double> getRange()
        An interval containing all values in the codomain of the function. Some implementations may not quickly be able to calculate the smallest such interval, in which case they should return a close approximation guaranteed, to contain the exact smallest interval.
        Returns:
        The extent of the codomain

      • getRangeBetween

        uk.co.strangeskies.mathematics.Range<Double> getRangeBetween(double startX,
                                                             double endX)
        Find the interval between the smallest to the largest value of the codomain of the function within the given domain interval.
        Parameters:
        startX - The start of the domain interval whose range we wish to determine
        endX - The end of the domain interval whose range we wish to determine
        Returns:
        The range from the smallest to the largest value of the codomain of the function within the given interval

      • sample

        double sample(double xPosition)
        Find the resulting Y value of the function for a given X.
        Parameters:
        xPosition - The X value to resolve
        Returns:
        The Y value for the given X

      • resample

        SampledContinuousFunction resample(double startX,
                                   double endX,
                                   int resolvableUnits)
        Sometimes it is useful to linearise a continuous function in order to perform complex processing, or for display purposes. This method provides a linear view of any continuous function. Implementations may remove features which are unresolvable at the given resolution.
        Parameters:
        startX - The start of the interval we wish to sample over
        endX - The end of the interval we wish to sample over
        resolvableUnits - The minimum resolvable units within the given interval
        Returns:
        A new sampled, linear continuous function roughly equal to the receiver to the requested resolution
